results.title: Cycle of progress
results.brief_description: Operations of the Alcoa Aluminium Company in Western Australia. The first bauxite mining operations commenced in 1963 at Jarrahdale, Western Australia. The bauxite is taken by rail to the refinery at Kwinana from where the alumina is shipped to the smelters at Point Henry, Victoria and to industry all over the world. The benefits to Australia as a whole from the establishment of one of the largest aluminium industries in the world are stated.

results.title: Cutting of materials
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Humphrey Barron and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Approaching Automation”.
This film deals with the cutting of materials, using cutting, milling, drilling, turning. facing and threading machinery. Points out the advantages of pneumatic and electrical equipment over manual labour. Questions the applicability of some methods of cutting in use and sums up the benefits of part and full automation of existing plant.

results.title: The Culinary art of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese cooking is unique. It is based on seasonal culinary specialities, the preparation and serving of which is considered to be an art. Shows the buying of fresh fish and vegetables, the tea ceremony, a traditional dinner, cooking schools, family meals and the preparation of sukiyaki, tempura and sushi.

results.title: The Culbin story
results.creator_credit: E Marquis, I Anderson and Forestry Commission of Scotland
results.brief_description: Records the Forestry Commission’s achievements at afforestation on the sandy southern shore of Moray Firth, Scotland. This area was completely buried by sand in the late 17th century. In 1921 the Forestry Commission began their work by introducing marram grass to bind the sand. This proved unsuccessful so a thatched cover of brushwood was laid over the sand. Now nearly the whole area has been planted with Corsican pine which is proving effective in checking sand drifts.

results.title: Cry of the marsh
results.creator_credit: Bill Snyder and Bill Snyder Films
results.brief_description: Marshes are the breeding grounds of millions of water-birds and untold numbers of interrelated wildlife. These precious wetlands are being drained, victims of man’s relentless search for more farmland and urban space. The film captures the poetic beauty of marsh life, then the terror and awesome finality which results when man reclaims a marsh for his purposes.

results.title: A Crutch for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and Burt Martin Associates
results.brief_description: An examination of the personal dependencies of three young people - for Frank the crutch was liquor, for Billy it was pot, for Max it was hard stuff. Each becomes involved in tragedy and each, at the brink, turns back from his false dependency.

results.title: Cross country runner
results.creator_credit: Mark McCarty and Department of Theatre Arts, University of California
results.brief_description: A light-hearted allegorical spoof of modern society, depicting the trials and tribulations of a cross-country runner who takes time out from a race to visit friends and family. Cast includes David Aldrich.

results.title: Critical path
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Uses the construction of a service station to illustrate the critical path method of planning and scheduling, in which a project is broken down into distinct operations, the time for completion of each estimated, and the longest irreduceable sequence of operations calculated. Consecutive and concurrent operations are identified and the most efficient use of working time planned.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 1
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed.

results.title: The Creative person: Tyrone Guthrie
results.creator_credit: Joyce Chopra and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A profile of Tyrone Guthrie the eminent theatrical director, showing him in several locales while he works, lectures and relaxes. In interviews he discusses his general philosophy towards the theatre as a medium. June Havoc and Darren McGavin describe the feelings which most actors have towards working with Guthrie.
